intro: Astragalus zacharensis, commonly known as the Zacharensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus zacharensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
